body.p: Louisville, Kentucky physician. Lexington, Kentucky native. Tutored by James Logue. Graduated from Transylvania University, Lexington, Kentucky, in 1832. Married Susan F. Hewitt Bell in 1833. Father of Carson H. Bell. Worked as a tailor while a teenager. Librarian of Transylvania University while he attended the school. Worked in Dr. Dudley’s office in Lexington in 1832. Partnered with Dr. Meriwether in Louisville from July 1832 til his death. Wrote for the Louisville Advertiser and the Louisville Journal. Appointed University of Louisville Chair of the Science and Art of Medicine and Public Hygiene in 1857. During the Civil War, he directed a military hospital in Louisville and served on the Board of Examining Surgeons. President of the Western division of the United States Sanitary Commission. Deacon of the First Church of the Disciples, Louisville.
